TextpageLeftNav.bodyText:
MySQL Database on Azure

Managed MySQL database service for app developers

1RMB Trial Buy Now

We are ending the MySQL Database on Azure service on December 1st, 2019, which will be replaced by the Azure Database for MySQL service. Please click here for migration FAQ and instruction.

MySQL Database on Azure is a relational database provided by Azure. It is compatible with the MySQL agreement, offering users a database platform with stable performance, easy operations and high security. It takes only one to two minutes for you to create a MySQL database server with high availability on Azure without the need to manage the Virtual Machine or infrastructure. MySQL Database on Azure provides users with easy management and maintenance features and experience. You can easily monitor database performance and resource use and shift among different versions based on your demand. MySQL Database on Azure provides at most 35 days of data backups and recovery options. Moreover, compared with MySQL servers set up by users themselves on Azure Virtual Machine, MySQL Database on Azure offers a better price to performance ratio.

Versions and Detailed Pricing Details

MySQL Database on Azure provides eight different versions, with performance increasing from lowest to highest.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly pricing estimates are based on 744 hours of usage per month.

MySQL Database on Azure supports rapid and flexible shifting between different versions. You can choose a version according to estimated current performance of your application and then make timely adjustment according to actual operation status and performance monitoring provided by MySQL Database on Azure to find the most suitable version.

* Readable standby database can be operated to add a subordinate instance that is the same as the primary library, which will be charged at the same rate as the primary instance.

FAQ

Expand all

MySQL Database on Azure Retirement Customer FAQ

We have summarized detailed FAQ for your better migration experiences from MySQL Database on Azure. Please refer to the MySQL Database on Azure migration FAQ and instructions.

General

  • How can I expand its capacity if my database is over 100GB?

    We provide 100GB of free database capacity. For the exceeding part, users do not need to perform extra operations and we will automatically charge it as web Blob Storage (Geo-Redundant Storage): ¥0.61/GB/month.

  • What is billed if my database server is active for less than one hour?

    Hours are charged based on the time the database server exists, and if the time is shorter than one hour, it will be charged for one hour. For instance, if you create an MS1 level database and immediately upgrade it into an MS2 level database, the first hour will be charged at the standard of an MS2 database. If you delete a database server and create another one with the same name later, the two independent database servers will be respectively charged for the hour.

  • How long does it take to change the version of the database service?

    Usually within 3 minutes.

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

MySQL Database on Azure provides a Service Level Agreement for 99.9% operating time to ensure high availability and business continuity for users. To learn more about the details of our Service Level Agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.

TextpageLeftNav.metaDescription: Learn about the pricing details of MySQL Database on Azure. MySQL Database on Azure provides six versions with their performance improving from the lowest to the highest. A 1RMB Trial gets you ¥1,500 in service credits. You can also make a direct purchase and become a Pay-in-Advance Azure customer.
